intro: Alternanthera panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian Alternanthera, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, often red or purple-colored foliage. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and is known for its rapid growth rate. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a velvety texture, while its small, inconspicuous flowers appear in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
